snippet: Mohammad Yazdi, 83, the new chairman of the Assembly of Experts, which chooses the supreme leader, is a former head of the judiciary.
abstract: Mohammad Yazdi is elected chairman of Iran's Assembly of Experts, receiving 47 votes among 73 clerics; was former head of judiciary and is deeply opposed to any relaxation of social rules; if ayatollah dies or becomes incapacitated, assembly is in charge of selecting new supreme leader.
lead_paragraph: Mohammad Yazdi, 83, the new chairman of the Assembly of Experts, which chooses the supreme leader, is a former head of the judiciary.

headline.main: Conservative Cleric Chosen to Lead Iranian Council
headline.print_headline: Iran: Conservative Cleric Is Elected to Lead Council
